intro: Lewisia rediviva subsp. maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's Lewisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of blue-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
